text: The following conditions are necessary for germination except
explanation: Conditions necessary for germination of seeds are adequate moisture,viable seed (living embryo),optimum temperature,adequate air and zero temperature is not included

text: _________ is the sowing of seed by drilling with stick or knife, followed by dropping seeds and covering them
explanation: Drilling: sowing a seed by drilling with stick or knife, followed by dropping seeds and covering them

text: The process whereby the embryo of a seed resumes growth under favourable conditions is called
explanation: Germination: the process whereby the embryo of a seed resumes growth under favourable conditions. Germination is the sprouting of seed.

text: _______ refers to the appearance of a seedling above soil level.
explanation: Emergence: this refers to the appearance of a seedling above soil level.

text: The young plants that emerge during germination are called
explanation: seedling is a young plants grown from seed, rather than from cutting

text: One of the followings is not a basic consideration in planting operations
explanation: Basic consideration in planting operations are planting depth, planting time, planting space

text: __________ is the distance of the sown seed in the soil from the soil surface
explanation: Planting depth is the distance of the sown seed in the soil from the soil surface. The correct planting depth is one that places the seed where it can imbibe water

text: __________ is a special place prepared for raising seedlings which are later taken to the field for proper planting.
explanation: Nursery is a special place prepared for raising seedlings which are later taken to the field for proper planting (transplanting).Seedlings are grown in nursery beds, seed trays or boxes, basket or polythene bags may be used as boxes. E.g. of such crops are cocoa, kola, tomatoes, citrus etc.

text: The following are post planting operations except
explanation: Post planting operations are the operations carried out after planting. It creates a good condition and proper maintenance for plants growth e.g Thinning, Supplying, Mulching,Harvesting

text: The removal of excess seedlings from a seedbed after the viable seeds have germinated is
explanation: Thinning is the removal of excess, weak or not well positioned seedlings from a seedbed after the viable seeds have germinated

text: _________ is the artificial watering of farmland
explanation: Irrigation(watering) is the artificial watering of farmland especially during dry season

text: Which of the following methods of storage is used for grains
explanation: Silos is a tall round metal tower or pit on a farm used to store grain

text: Some seeds are raised in the nursery because

options.D: So that they can get enough sunshine

explanation: The seedlings are weak and may not survive in field. They require protection from sunlight and rainfall.

text: This is the removal of unwanted plants on the farm
explanation: Weeding is the removal of unwanted plants (weeds) from the farm. It can be done with the aid of cutlass and hoes or by spraying herbicide. It is done for the following reasons:-To avoid competition for nutrients, moisture, sunlight and space between crops and weed.-To prevent the buildup of pest and pathogens.

text: The following problems are usually associated with subsistence agriculture except

options.C: It requires a large area of land

explanation: The practice of commercial agriculture requires several hectares of land to operate successfully.

text: Which of the following processes is not used in rice processing
explanation: Fermentation is the breakdown of a substance by bacteria, yeasts or other microorganisms typically invovolving effervescence and the giving off of heat. Threshing, Winnowing and perboiling are used in rice processing.

text: Primary tillage is also known as
explanation: Ploughing is cutting through the soil and making it into lumps or clods of soil. It is called primary tillage. While secondary tillage (harrowing) is the use of harrow to break down the large clods of soil into fine particles and making it ready for ridging

text: Climatic factors which affects organisms include the following except
explanation: A rock is a solid collection of mineral grains that grow or become cemented together. some rocks are large while others are small.

text: The following animals are polygastric animals except
explanation: A polygastric digestive system is a system comprising of a four-chambered stomach. This form of the digestive system is common among ruminants such as cattle, sheep and deer

text: Which branch of ecology deals with the study of an individual organism and its interaction with the environment is
explanation: Autecology is concerned with the study of an individual organism, or a single species of organism and its environment. For example the study of a single cattle and its environment.

text: The vertical section of the soil showing series of horizontal layers of different types of soil is called
explanation: Soil profile is defined as the vertical section of the soil, showing series of horizontal layers of different types of soil. These horizontal layers are called horizons.

text: The A-Horizon of soil profile is also called the
explanation: The A-Horizon, also called the top soil, represents the surface layer of the soil profile. This horizon contains more organic matter than other horizons. The A horizon, the top soil, is the most weathered and leached of all the soil horizons.

text: The B-Horizon of soil profile is also called the
explanation: The B-horizon, also called the sub-soil, is the next horizon immediately after the top soil. It is rich in minerals which are carried or leached down by percolating water.

text: ____________ is said to occur when a ration does not provide all the food nutrients in adequate quantities needed by animal.
explanation: Malnutrition is said to occur when a ration (amount of feed provided to an animal per day) does not provide all the food nutrients(carbohydrate, protein,fats and oils, vitamins, minerals, water and other feed additives) in adequate quantities. Those nutrients wanting are said to be deficient which eventually results in nutritional disease.

text: The feed that is regularly offered to or consumed by the animal is called
explanation: A ration is defined as the feed that is regularly offered to or consumed by the animal. Diets are formulated to meet specific metabolic or physiological functions which include growth, lactation, reproduction, maintenance of pregnancy, egg laying, weaning, fattening etc

text: Which of the following type of rations will supplies the animal with just the quantity of nutrients that are enough to enable the animal carry on with vital body activities without losing or gaining another substance
explanation: A maintenance ration is the amount of feed needed to prevent an increase or decrease in the weight of the animal. The ration will just be enough to maintain the supplies of energy and protein for all metabolic activities such as respiration, blood circulation, digestion, locomotion, maintenance of body temperature.

text: The quantity of ration that can supply the requirement nutrients above the maintenance to enable the animal produce the form of animal product for which the livestock is kept is known as
explanation: The production ration can be for meat, growth, milk, wool and egg production. The food is supplied in excess of maintenance requirements.

text: Which of the following classes of nutrient is used only for energy production in farm animals?
explanation: Carbohydrates are the main source of energy for the body. They are sugars, starches and dietary fibre.

text: ________ is a disease condition which emanates from inadequate nutrition.
explanation: Nutritional deficiency is therefore defined as a disease condition which emanates from inadequate nutrition. It is indicated by specific symptoms when particular nutrients are absent or unavailable in the diet.

text: Preservation of fish prevents the following except
explanation: Preservation prevents spoilage, injury or destruction and this keeps the fish in edible condition for a long time. Preservation does not prevent processing

text: Which of the following is a powerful and expensive multipurpose motor vehicle used for lifting or pulling farm implements?
explanation: -TRACTOR: It is a powerful and expensive multipurpose motor vehicle used for lifting or pulling farm implements-BULLDOZERS: They are powerful tractors and expensive machines with a broad steel blade or sheet at the front.-SHELLERS: These are machines operated electrically, mechanically or manually. Shellers are used to separate the seeds from the husk or cob.-INCUBATORS: These are machines which are used for hatching fertilized eggs artificially.

text: The following are types of planters except
explanation: RIDGER: It is a secondary tillage implement used for land preparation, it is used after harrow and before planter.

text: Which of the following is not a type of harvester?
explanation: PLOUGH:This is a primary tillage implement which is attached to a tractor. It is the first implement required in land preparation. Others are types of harvester.

text: The followings are functions of a sprayer except

options.A: It can be used to control the growth of weeds
options.B: It can be used to control the effects of pest.
options.C: It can be used to plant seeds
options.D: It can be used to spray disinfectant.

explanation: Sprayers are types of equipment designed to spray certain chemicals in various farm operations and not for planting seeds.

text: Which of these is not an example of tractor coupled implement?
explanation: Tractor coupled implements are implements which are coupled or attached to a tractor in order to enable if perform its work. They are also called intermediate farm machinery.Incubators are machines which are used for hatching fertilized eggs artificially and they are not attached to a tractor.

text: ___________ is the process which assist farmers through educational procedures in improving farming methods
explanation: Agricultural extension is the process, system or service which assists farmers or farm people through educational procedures in improving farming methods and techniques.

text: One of the followings is not an objective of agricultural extension

options.B: To help improve the standard of living of rural dwellers
options.C: To abandon the development of rural area
options.D: To help identify proper market channel

explanation: Agricultural extension help accelerate the development of rural area and not abandon them

text: The principles of agricultural extension includes the following except

options.D: Reduce the confidence of your audience

explanation: other options are principles of agricultural extension except to reduce the confidence of your audience

text: __________is used to create awareness and interest in the new ideas and techniques among the majority of the people
explanation: mass media method enables many people to know about the new innovation. This method involves the use of publications,leaflets,posters,agricultural shows and exhibitions

text: The following are examples of agricultural extension except
explanation: Examples of extension Programmes include: Agricultural Development Programme(ADP), Farm Settlement Scheme, Agro-Service Centres, Research Institutes,Green revolution programme, Operation feed the nation

text: Which of the following is not an organic manure?
explanation: Fertilizers are chemical substances which are usually prepared in the farm, they are made in form of liquid, powder, granules, pellets or crystals

text: Which of these operations comes first in cultural practice?
explanation: Stumping is the removal of stumps by digging them out manually using cutlasses and axes. It can also be done mechanically by using bulldozer. Stumps are the left over cut trees on the farm left on the soil surface

text: The botanical name of maize is
explanation: Maize also called corn is a member of the grass family (Gramineae). It produces grains, use as food by human beings and livestock. Zea mays is botanical name of maize

text: Cultural practices can be classified into the following except
explanation: Cultural practices are the various activities carried out on the farm before, during and after planting to ensure proper growth and establishment of crops.

text: Which of the following is not a pre-planting operations?
explanation: Pre planting operations are the operations carried out before planting. Thinning is a post planting operation

text: Water yam is also known as
explanation: Yam belongs to the family Dioscoreacea. It is a root and tuber crop grown in West Africa and it is rich in carbohydrates.Water yam (Dioscorea alata)

text: Legumes that produce edible seeds are known as
explanation: Cowpea is a member of the pulses or legumes. It belongs to the family leguminoseae. It is rich in protein. The fruit of cowpea is called Pod

text: _________ is concerned with the study of the inter-relationships between groups of organisms living together in an area
explanation: Synecology is concerned with the study of the inter-relationships between groups of organisms or species of organisms living together in an area. For example the study of different fishes in a fish pond in relation to their aquatic environment

text: ___________ consists of living factors(plants and animals) interacting with the non-living factors in a farm environment
explanation: Ecosystem refers to a community of crop plants and farm animals functioning together with their non-living environment.

text: Which of the followings is not an abiotic components of an ecosystem?
explanation: The abiotic components of an ecosystem include the non-living things such as oxygen, topography, temperature. Micro-organisms are living things and they are biotic components of an ecosystem

text: The animal dungs are used as_____to improve the soil fertility
explanation: The animal dungs and droppings are used as organic manure to improve the soil fertility for the crops

text: Fishing methods involves the use of the following different techniques or equipments except
explanation: Poisoning is the introduction of harmful substance into organisms which can kill them

text: The following steps are necessary when establishing a fish pond except
explanation: STEPS IN ESTABLISHING FISH POND-Site selection: This involves the choice of best site based on necessary conditions like, a piece of land through which a perennial stream flows.-General survey: Detailed survey of the chosen site should be carried out, especially by extension workers.-Clearing and stumping of site: This involves removal of trash, cutting of trees and removal of stumps.-Construction of dam: This is usually constructed across the stream. Clay soil should be used for dam construction because of its ability to hold water.Moisture is not needed.

text: In ponds, fish is usually caught with the following except
explanation: Pollution is the contamination of the environment by releasing harmful substance into it.

text: One of the followings is not a type of pond
explanation: It is a confined body of water where fishes are raised under controlled conditions. Fish can also be raised in plastics, fiber stars and wooden rafts.There are three types of pond: Earthen pond, Concrete pond and Plastic pond

text: Which of the followings is not an advantage of Introduction

options.B: It leads to the absence of pests and diseases
options.D: Breeds may perform better in terms of quality and quantity

explanation: Disadvantages of introduction is that it may not perform maximally while others are advantages of introduction

text: The mating of unrelated individual animals within the same breed is called
explanation: Out breeding is the mating of unrelated individual animals within the same breed.Out breeding is the opposite of in-breeding. It produces offspring with greater vigour and productivity

text: The following are solutions to poor transportation network experienced by farmers except

options.A: Construction of new roads to open up the rural areas
options.B: Provision of motor vehicles, boats and trains to facilitate distribution of farm products.
options.C: Reduction in transportation cost to make such affordable to rural farmers.

explanation: Presence of bad roads or total lack of good roads makes distribution of produces to the market very difficult, and this leads to wastage

text: Which of the following is not a role of science and technology in agricultural development in Nigeria?
explanation: Poor transportation network or total lack of good roads makes distribution of produces to the market very difficult, and this leads to wastage

text: The major factors affecting the application of science and technology to Nigeria agriculture include the following except

options.C: Unwillingness of farmer to adopt scientific method

explanation: Availability of fund is not a major factor affecting the application of science and technology to Nigeria agriculture

text: Bulldozers are powerful tractors and expensive machines with a
explanation: Bulldozers are powerful tractors and expensive machines with a broad steel blade or sheet at the front.

text: Bulldozer is used for the following purpose except
explanation: Bulldozer has tract-type metal chains, used for its movement in bush clearing, felling trees and stumps, leveling the ground except planting of trees

text: Which of the following is not a component of an incubator ?
explanation: Temperature is the degree of hotness or coldness of a body.

text: The following are advantages of using disc plough over mouldboard plough in West Africa except

options.A: Disc plough makes deeper cuts than mouldboard plough
options.B: Disc plough buries weeds more completely than mouldboard plough
options.C: The disc plough is designed to roll over stumps and obstacles which may easily damage the edges of mouldboard plough
options.D: Mouldboard plough makes deeper cuts than disc plough

explanation: Mouldboard plough makes deeper cuts than disc plough is not one of the advantages of using disc plough over mouldboard plough

text: _______ is a secondary tillage implement
explanation: Harrow is a secondary tillage implement also used for land preparation. It can also be driven by work animals or a tractor. It is used immediately after ploughing and before ridging

text: Broadcast Crop Planter is designed

options.A: to plant seeds along the rows in a ridge.
options.B: to place the correct number of seed(s) into a hole with regular spacing within and between rows
options.C: to plant seeds by random scattering of seeds about the field.
options.D: to place the correct number of seeds into the soil

explanation: -Row Crop Planter: This is designed to plant seeds along the rows in a ridge.-Precision Planters: This is designed to place the correct number of seed(s) into a hole with regular spacing within and between rows.-Grain Drill Planters: This is designed to place the correct number of seeds into the soil and space them between rows, but not within rows.

text: A person who is involved in the dissemination of new ideas and techniques from the research institutes to the farmers is called
explanation: Agricultural Extension Officer is a person who is involved in the dissemination of new ideas and techniques from the research institutes to the farmers.He acts as an intermediary between researchers and the farmers.

text: Roles of an extension agent includes the following except

options.A: He does not liaises with other agencies
options.B: He plans and executes farming educational programmes
options.C: He supervises the utilization of agricultural loans
options.D: He conducts or organizes training for farmers

explanation: He liaises with other agencies that may have influence on rural environment and the farmers.

text: ___________ is a process of spreading new ideas and information from research station to reach farm families
explanation: Diffusion is the movement of new ideas and information from area of higher concentration to area of lower concentration through a medium(extension Officer) and extension method.

text: Agricultural extension serves as ____ between research institute and farmers
explanation: Agricultural extension is the process whereby the beneficial products of research are taken to the farmers and the problems of farmers taken to research institutions for solution

text: Television, radio, posters, bulletin are ____ method of extension
explanation: Mass media method involves the use of publications,leaflets,posters,agricultural shows and exhibitions,cinema vans,Newspaper, radio and television,Newsletter,Circular,News Bulletins,Pamphlets,film shows etc

text: The following are extension methods except
explanation: Methods used in dissemination of new ideas and techniques to farmers are grouped into three classes:-Mass media method-Individual method-Group method

text: Which of the following is a disadvantages of mass method

options.A: It is very expensive to operate
options.D: Does not necessarily require the presence of an agent

explanation: The other options are advantages of mass method except that it is very expensive to operate

text: __________ is a pictorial presentation meant to educate or inform the literate audience
explanation: A poster is a pictorial presentation meant to educate or inform the literate audience as the pictures cater for all the needed information

text: ________ is all written ideas and innovation for literate to read, understand and apply.
explanation: A bulletin is all written ideas and innovation for literate to read, understand and apply.Home or farm visit involves one on one or personalized visit to the farmer's home or farm to establish mutual friendship and acquaint with the farmer and family before giving ideas and information to such a farmer

text: The following problems are encountered by an agricultural extension agent except

options.C: High level of literacy among farmers
options.D: High level of illiteracy among farmers

explanation: High level of illiteracy among farmers may affect the rate of adopting of new farming techniques and not high level literacy among farmers.

text: There are________ Steps or stages of Diffusion process
explanation: Five Steps or stages of Diffusion process include-Awareness-Interest-Evaluation-Trial-Adoption/Rejection/Discontinuation

text: The following are categories of farmers based on adoption of innovation except
explanation: Never innovators does not belong to the categories of farmers based on adoption of innovation

text: ______ introduce new ideas of farming seen in other places to their dwelling.
explanation: Innovators introduce new ideas of farming seen in other places to their dwelling. Due to inexperience or error they might suffer losses and can be encouraged by giving expert advice, granting credit facilities, providing and subsidizing farm inputs, granting insurance cover, providing market for sale of produce.

text: ________ are less quick to accepting innovations which might be largely due to some of the aforementioned factors
explanation: Early adopters are less quick to accepting innovations which might be largely due to some of the aforementioned factors. If percentage of these set is as low as 10% then such innovation has not been uniformly accepted maybe due to hitch during demonstration or the idea is too complex to understand
